name: Radisson Ambassador Plaza Hotel & Casino San Juan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here before a flight to Dominica earlier this year. The location was outstanding but the hotel itself left room for much improvement. Based on the physical structure of the building we assumed it was not constructed to be a Radisson. It has an overall feeling of “disjointedness”. The taxi dropped us at the entrance to the hotel which is actually on the side of the building. There was no one to greet us and help with luggage. This would present a problem for older guests or people with disabilities. The lobby entrance is dark, thick with cigarette smoke and generally feels dreary.
reviews.title: Great Location but Choose Another Hotel

reviews.text: We paid for Ambassador’s Club level services and it was a waste of money. The room itself was average and the bathroom was tiny. However, on the plus side, the Sleep Number bed was outstanding. We were supposed to have complimentary bathrobes and had to call for them. Another service we paid for was nightly turndown service which we never received. The room safe did not work properly so we requested service. The “expert” came and whatever he did left the safe still not working. Hot breakfast was supposedly included with the cost of the room; it was not.
reviews.title: You could do better....

reviews.text: The hotel is constructed in such a way that many things simply do not “flow” physically. One selling point for the Ambassador’s Club is private check-in and check-out but this is done on the top floor of a separate tower. The swimming pool and billiards room are also located in a separate tower. We expected that at the very least they would provide a written explanation of where things were located on the property but that didn’t happen. This made for a frustrating stay to say the least.
reviews.title: Okay, But Ready To Try Someplace Else

likes.disliked: — Noise from other rooms, uncomfortable bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we felt we paid far too much money for what we received. We’ve stayed at much cheaper hotels with nicer accommodations and better service. Checkout was a zoo and the clerk was not the least bit concerned that we were dissatisfied. We were scheduled to stay at the Radisson on our way back from Dominica but changed our hotel.
reviews.title: Just okay

likes.liked: — location very close to cruise docks
likes.disliked: — a bit dark and gloomy, and the location of our room near very loud HVAC equipment

reviews.text: Completely separate from the Radisson, the location is outstanding. There are several stores and some great restaurants within walking distance – be sure to check out Yerba and the Asian Fusion restaurant down the street. The local bus (Number 21) costs only 75 cents and goes to Old San Juan. If you feel like walking about an hour, you can walk to Old San Juan. The beach is a couple of blocks from the hotel.
reviews.title: Just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service wise it was better then the Radisson in Melbourne Florida. San Juan had bell man and concierge in the lobby to help out. Our room had a view of the street and we kept hearing a banging noise from (maybe) the water pipes. We were able to tolerate it but it could definitely drive many guests crazy. There are also balcony rooms on the other side that overlook the parking lot and we wish we had gotten one of those.
reviews.title: A great hotel if it was under $100 a night

likes.disliked: — The banging noise in my room.

reviews.text: Entertainment wise it was great. The casino is there. They do deal Blackjack a little bit weird here. They had a lounge with Salsa music both nights that we were there. If you like to dance with an older crowd, this is the place.
reviews.title: Decent location; average Hotel..Some staff issues..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Take the elevator ride to the rooftop pool it is pretty cool. No good views from this hotel. It is blocked from the beach by other buildings.
reviews.title: Worst Radisson I've Ever Seen

likes.liked: — There are many good restaurants nearby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was overpriced and not much better then a sports bar. Wander a block down the street to much better restaurants.
reviews.title: OK Hotel - Great Location!

reviews.text: I have stayed here a few times for business/pleasure combo.. Not my first choice. Location is decent but a bit further down the Ashford strip than I like to be ( towards the lagoon and first few blocks there are better: Condado Plaza/Marriott,etc).. A lot of Airline Crews stay here (which tells you its budget minded) and you will see a lot of them. Room was a little vintage, but comfortable. Not great views in comparison with other properties.. Three of us were literally locked in the Hot Tub on the roof at 'closing' of the pool. The Security Guard SAW us, walked past us, said nothing, and locked the doors back to the elevators. The only way to get back in to the hotel was to go thru a Wedding Reception room (in progress with a wedding recep) and exit the other side, in our bathing suits and towels!.. Then, the security man there didn't want us to do it and disturb the reception and held us at bay in the corridor for almost an hour!! We eventually pushed him aside and went thru the reception anyway. Absolutely ridiculous and unprofessional. Otherwise, an okay, safe property.
reviews.title: Great stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at the Radisson. We stayed 6 days 5 nights for our 20th wedding anniversary. The hotel is great and the service excellent. Everything was very clean and the staff is friendly, helpful and courteous. The pool, the gym and the casino were our favorite places. The food was excellent as well as the entertainment. The hotel is located close to many stores and the Old San Juan. Transportation is available all the time. We stayed at other Radisson's (no need to mention the States) before but this is the best one.
reviews.title: Great hotel, wonderful experience

likes.liked: — Everything. Location, ammenities, food, service, etc.

reviews.text: Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in and we'll most likely come back again!
reviews.title: Great Experience at the Radisson

reviews.text: Read a lot of the reviews about the Radisson in San Juan, P.R. and many were negative. I got a great rate through Priceline for two rooms at $80.00 per night for each room. We were travelling with two friends and were looking for a nice motel at a good rate, since it was in the low season.
reviews.title: Radisson Ambassador - Puerto Rico

likes.liked: — Location on main strip in Puerto Rico
likes.disliked: — Initial check in, distance to suitable beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although apprehensive due to many of the reviews I had read about the hotel, I made up my mind to take them at face value and be open minded and not have unrealistic expectations. Boy was I pleasantly surprised!
reviews.title: I'm ambivalent about the Radisson San Juan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *Check-In was seemless and smooth. The clerk could not have been more kind, professional, or nice.
reviews.title: A little pricy

reviews.text: We stayed here pre-cruise one night - 24 of us total. Not bad
reviews.title: Perfect for One Night

reviews.text: for one night. We ate at the grill for lunch - food and prices
reviews.title: Exactly what we expected

reviews.text: were good! Rooftop pool was nice we actually all hung out
reviews.title: Great Ambassador Club Room for cheap
What a night!!!
reviews.text: there at night and ordered pizza. This hotel is in the heart
of the San Juan and honestly not in the best area especially
reviews.title: Almost exceptional

likes.liked: — Rene Vargas & the pool on the roof!
likes.disliked: — The balcony faced Burger King... YUK!

aka: Radisson Ambassador Plaza Hotel And Casino San Juan
